text: The nomads will show us how to survive in this desolate land.
The Barbarians will show us how to survive in this frozen land.
The Dawi will show us how to traverse the mountains.
A baggage train will allow our camp to grow further.
A young one to lessen the bureaucratic burden.
Those who help the Dawi are repaid in kind.
As a result of the Grudgebringers' growing importance, the Empire sees fit to aid us further.
Mercenaries of such standing do not come cheaply, but you get what you pay for.
It's good to have one whose job it is to speak on your behalf.\\n"Let me tell you a tale..."
Haggling is child's play to hard-nosed mercenaries.
A seasoned paymaster ensures the troops are paid well for their work, but not too well.
It's not rare for Mercenaries to undertake more... underhanded tasks.
We are kept as retainers to the rulers, and the troops are kept as our retainers in kind.
Deals with local rulers and warlords see them supply new soldiers for the promise of future protection.
More and more gather around the Grudgebringers
Mercenaries with a reputation for enacting Sigmar's will attract the most devout zealots.
A handful of camps, all working together in aid of the Grudgebringers.
Small fortifications, strategically placed where they are needed, make facing the Grudgebringers a grueling task.
Everyone is put through rigorous training before they set foot on the the battlefield, an attractive prospect for those who want to live long enough to spend their pay.
The mercenary wagon master's sole job is to ferry fresh troops to the frontline, exactly where they're needed.
Aged veterans who can no longer fight can teach the rabble a lesson or two.
It's nice to have tents that don't look like the slightest breeze will knock them down.
